alert.note: Alert for Harney (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 6:19AM PDT until May 02 at 11:22AM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Silvies River Near Burns affecting Harney County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Silvies River...including Burns...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Silvies River Near Burns. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding of fields will occur in the Burns area. Water will encroach on some private properties along North Broadway Avenue, Foley Road, and Stancliff Road. Water will be close to flowing on to Highway 20 at the Silvies River Bridge. Low spots in the Burns RV Park may be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM PDT Saturday was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 13.3 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall early Friday morning, May 05. It will rise to 12.2 feet early next Saturday morning, May 06. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday, May 07. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 03/19/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1045 AM PDT.
